data.title: Best Texmex food in Grand Prairie TX Great Prices/specials
data.text: I go to the drive up window and grab and go, prices are good and they have specials 7 days a week! Tastes Great!

data.title: This is our 40th year of eating at Don Juans.
data.text: You can bet the food taste exactly the same today as it did for the past several decades. Wonderful, fresh, and large portions. Cannot come anywhere near this little gem without going to eat. So stop in and give it a try. You will not be disappointed.

data.title: Good food
data.text: Good place to eat small older place. We come here offer food is a good price. Workers are usually friendly. Quick service.

data.title: Celebrating the restaurant's 1966 opening
data.text: Yes we are in line waiting to get our mexican dinners at 1966 prices. We are regular customers at Don Juans. Taco plates have been a staple of ours every Thursday for years. Great place for a quick lunch.

data.title: Almost Weekly visit
data.text:
Been here a long time & still a great stop or drive thru!! Has daily specials &retro special events! Thurs tacos is almost every week! Food is great for tex-mex...fried greenbeans,too!
Small inside eating area but has outside if weather good &drive thru still works! Great for meeting friends place...&remind the wife that I'm being romantic! 😎 
Managers are great &help has always been friendly &helpful!

data.title: Back again...
data.text: Back for the Alabama vs Usc game and couldn't wait to get off the plane to get here. My wife got the guacamole chalupa and i got the burrito covered with chili. The habanero salsa was good but hot! We need good places like this in Alabama!

data.title: Thursday special!
data.text: We go there often. The tacos are good at a reasonable price on Thursday. I also love the nacho supreme they put way more toppings than other places. We also get the party pack often and it feeds our family of 6 with leftovers for around $30. Not the best food but it is good at a very reasonable price.

data.title: Hometown Favorite
data.text: I have been eating here since the early 70's. This is the type of place you would expect to see featured in "Diners, Drive Ins and Dives" on Food Network. It's definitely a drive in and in fact one of the first if not the first to serve Mexican food. It's definitely a dive and that's what makes this place what it is! It has the exact same decor from the 70's and possibly the actual same furnishings. The food taste exactly the same as it has since I first started eating there in the 70's. My favorite items are the enchiladas and the tacos. Plus, I love the "hot sauce" in bottles on each table (available for take out and don't forget to get some!). There is a simple good flavor to all items and nothing fancy about it, and that is perfect!

data.title: Family Favorite
data.text: This is Tex-Mex food.  The service is good. The food has been the same for years.  It is not my favorite place, but I love it just the same.  I have been taking my daughter here since she was about 5 years old.  I have moved out of Grand Prairie, but I still stop and get her a platter.

data.title: Week of June 20, 2016
data.text: This Tex-Mex restaurant had been here for as long as I can remember. I first tried it for lunch in 1973. It was one of my first experiences with this type of cuisine and I have been coming back ever since. The only thing that has changed is the prices but that's to be expected. I make it a habit to order the same meal every time. No one restaurant can make it better.

data.title: Business week of March 4, 2016
data.text: Fantastic Mexican food from tacos, burritos, enchiladas, etc. This establishment has been at this same location for 50+ years and I have been a diehard customer since 1973.  They have good quality meals at affordable prices.  Their all meat, onions and cheese burritos are my favorite meal that I order every week. You will not regret a visit.  It is a very clean establishment.  The service is fast but it doesn't taste like your typical fast-food restaurant.

data.title: A Grand Prairie Tradition
data.text: I've been eating here for more than 40 years.  Love the tacos and their kiddie bean burritos.  Employees are always pleasant and ready to serve.  It may not be for everyone, but once you're hooked, you're loving Don Juan's for life!

data.title: Won't return
data.text: Very greasy meat, which is the best part of a dish. It also felt dirty and the staff seemed impatient.

data.title: Just let this restaurant.  Wow!!! Help lovely, atmosphere (hometownish), food very good, prices attractive.
data.text: Drove through a little "rougher area of town" to get here so had some doubts.  BUT....help was gracious, efficient, food good, menu choices varied, prices were not bad.  We had the Mexican plate and the soapapillas, which were absolutely spectacular--like none I have found since Denver.  I liked the atmosphere, dated, but that is not a turn-off for us.  Try it, you will be amazed!

data.title: Yummy
data.text: Just got off a plane and headed here to eat. 5 beef tacos for $6.35 and they were good. My wife had the guacamole chalupa and cheese chips. Great waitstaff who gave us a tip about cake balls down the street.

data.title: 40 years of lovin Don Juans!
data.text: My wife and I have been enjoying Don Juans since we were little kids. It's not like any Mexican you have ever had. Some might say it's an acquired taste.  Probably is. But man, we drive in from east Texas a couple times a month and hit DJs every time! Love the bean burritos! Ask for extra cheese.

data.title: Family tradition
data.text: Have enjoyed Don Juan's food since back in the 80's, never disappointed. Anytime we visit GP we have to stop to eat, it's a must!

data.title: A Grand Prairie Tradition
data.text: Don Juan's has been on Main Street since 1966.  It is definitely not a chain restaurant, so if you're looking for a very cookie-cutter place, keep driving.   It has a pretty standard Tex-Mex menu.  There are specials everyday - pick the special of the day and you'll be happy.   Taco Thursday is very busy, but they can move people through quickly.  There is a drive thru, but go in and order at the counter.  I like the 60's decor.  The only downside to Don Juan's is that the bathroom is outside- it's locked but they will give you the code.   The bathroom is very clean.

data.title: Quaint Place in Historic Area
data.text: We visited this place before a concert at the Verizon Theater. Many other reviews seemed promising. It's a very quaint place and the people working there were all very nice. One thing for sure is that they have a lot of choices. My wife and I both got these platters which were about $7 each. I will say that the guacamole was extremely good. On the flip side the taste of what we got reminded me of Taco Bueno so I'm not hurrying to go back there myself. I might try it again and I will say that this was my first and only visit. There are plenty of choices so I think most people would probably find something that satisfies them.

data.title: Don Juans is the best
data.text: I have been eating at Don Juans since High School.  It is a home town favorite for all the folks in Grand Prairie.  I almost always run into someone I know.
